title: Who is the worst URF champ?
body: So there's like 8 bazillion posts on how X champ is OP or Y champ is busted in URF, but I'm curious who everyon thinks is the most useless champ.

replies.body: Yasuo
Sooo, "Hasaki!" is not the theme of URF? I'm ok with that.

The only thing really reduced is his windwall. His R still needs a knockup and his Q still needs 2 hits to charge that 3rd tornado slash.

Basically, he's literally the worst URF champ because he cannot actually do anything for 90% of the time. 9% of the rest of the time, someone is using knockup skills he can leech off of via his ulti and that 1% remainder is literally cream of the crop players and luck.
his q cd also depends olny on the attack speed
Tryndamere. You spin more. Congrats.
Full AP Trynd is one of the most broken things on URF.
Yeah. I've seen this and it makes me shudder.
Kindred without question
half second cd on Q with % health damage is bad now?
One ok ability for URF makes them good compared to everyone else? The thread title asks who the worst champion is, not who a bad champion is. The bar can start high.
i played aurelion sol and it was brutal, even if you've land your Q stun your stars are still slow as shit and you can't do anything

kindred
tom kench
yas
trist
no, no, no, and no

> [{quoted}](name=Dunkin Darius,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QcLYFm2y,comment-id=00090000,timestamp=2017-02-27T14:27:32.629+0000)
>
> no, no, no, and no

yes yes yes yes
no, no, yes, no

no, no, yes, no...

Oh wait, it's not a Simon Says game?  Shit. I thought I was the first one to make the match and won. :(      Sad day.

> [{quoted}](name=acehole76,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QcLYFm2y,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2017-02-27T09:54:54.592+0000)
>
> kindred
> tom kench
> yas
> trist

Wtf no tahm kench keeps you stun locked with q on urf.
and he gains the one stat that he benefits from the most offensively...atk speed

http://urf.lolalytics.com/champions/

Tahm Kench
Kalista
Katarina
Bard
Ryze
Taliyah
Nunu

the lowest winrates and likely candidates for most useless in the mode.

I like how they show the ban rates for all the champs. Most useful stat in a non-bannable game mode, haha. 

Also, that Fiora win rate. Yikes!
{{champion:136}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:157}}
I have yet to play Sion but I can see him sucking on Urf. All his abilities are too telegraphed to work in this mode.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QcLYFm2y,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2017-02-27T15:57:04.840+0000)
>
> I have yet to play Sion but I can see him sucking on Urf. All his abilities are too telegraphed to work in this mode.

Urf is not friendly to cast times at all.

Darius is literally urf shit solely because he still has the .75 second Q  delay hanging over his shoulders.

> [{quoted}](name=Ralanr,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QcLYFm2y,comment-id=000b0000,timestamp=2017-02-27T15:57:04.840+0000)
>
> I have yet to play Sion but I can see him sucking on Urf. All his abilities are too telegraphed to work in this mode.

By far one of the worst champions.
I've had him a couple of times and he's not terrible. But not super awesome either. If you find a good lane partner he can push the hell out of it by kicking minions every like 2 seconds.
playing singed in any mode is a miserable experience

> [{quoted}](name=Apocyliptic,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=QcLYFm2y,comment-id=000d,timestamp=2017-02-27T15:59:06.977+0000)
>
> {{champion:27}} 
> 
> ... His Q has less of a cooldown along with his goo and flip... yay, I guess?
> 
> The last time I got singed in Urf I was completely miserable. I tried to proxy, but when everyone has a dash up each second, it doesn't work, so you just walk around, useless and forgotten, sobbing uncontrollably.

NEVER ENDING ULT.
You can leave your q and ult on 100% of the time.

Yas is pretty much the same. Trist is the same, just more bombs. Kench you can eat more and spam your tongue. Kindred is broke. So much kite and on hit damage. But the least broken champ in urf? Easy - Riven. {{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}}  Lel
AP trist is broken
{{champion:157}} {{champion:136}}

{{champion:157}} 
Yasuo gains the least number of benefits overall. Everyone becomes much stronger in URF, but I think Yasuo gains the least overall. Singed is a close second, but at least he can permanently use his Q and have a permanent ultimate.

{{champion:157}}
because his regular gameplay is urf standard so he doesn't get stronger in urf.

I want to say Rumble.  He's still limited to the heat mechanic, so he's not gonna benefit from the cooldown reduction nearly as much.

Well, not until he hits 6 I suppose.
Volibear is complete garbage honestly
i know im late but volibear is fucking amazing
Urgot isn't too great, any that have long channel spells aren't doing that huge burst that other champions gain in the mode.

Amumu is easily the worst in URF.

One toggle ability, and otherwise needs to be in meele. Nothing is good about Amumu in URF.
It’s clearly Kalista. She’s utterly useless in URFz 😂

VERY hard to answer. Off the top of my head i would say Udyr {{champion:77}} wouldn't be the best choice. His abilities don't really gain much in the terms of cooldown. however the attack speed would buff him greatly though. Although i guess now that i think about it, he would be able to keep his ability specials active like turtle stance.... so he may not be that bad a chice.    {{champion:102}}  Shyvana is a good choice IMO, you basically button mash your W, and Q the whole game, oh and occasionally throw out an E. 

But who would be the worst is hard to answer. i would say that it would ba a champ that doesn't really benefit from the special urf buffs at all,,, but thats really hard to narrow it down.

Having played Udyr twice in URF on the first day, I gotta say Udyr is actually REALLY busted. Due to the way Tiger stance works, you can actually nuke people as hard as they can nuke you. Only.. They can't nuke you easily. You can switch stances almost instantly, letting you drop a tiger, turtle for shield, bear to reposition and still have time to tiger again before the DoT wears off. I loathe to imagine AP Flamedyr striking you with that burst every second.
ok, so there we go. my first guess was wrong.

Rek'Sai by far.

You cant get in their faces and dump a huge load of damage. Most champions get broken mobility, while she gets a less gimped version of her E.

Not even full AP works since Riot nerfed her Q ratio to 50% only.
{{champion:27}} {{champion:32}} {{champion:14}} {{champion:4}} {{champion:427}}
Udyr since he's really still just auto-ing and virtually every other champ in the game can just outrange and kite, or CC him til kill.

{{champion:266}} is definitely up there as one of the worst champions in URF imo, mainly for the fact that it'll be so hard for him to stick on people to really use his W which has no benefit in URF and with his long delay on his Q and that everyone gains free movement speed, no one would get hit by it. Also he has a hard time getting his passive to stack and work in normals, and it will probably be worse when people have so much more burst which Aatrox really doesn't have.

Maybe if you went AP Aatrox or AD-Poke where you rely on your E more than your W then you might be ok.

Yasuo because nothing changes with him. His Q cdr scales with attack speed, his windwall actually is effected, his e is already like under a second cd normally or something like that, and his ult is always up in normal modes anyways. All he gets is a perma windwall while everything else is the same
Champs that aren't really effected by cdr ig?
